title: ping issues
body:
every since i moved back to california  my ping has been spiking to about 300 ms randomly

it normally averages about 64 ping when stable but for unknown reasons it seems to spike.

now since i moved back in with my parents i don't have control of the router

however i have a good stable connection.. and VERY good download and upload speed 

i am using wireless but for some reason my router wont always talk to my computer

i dont ever disconnect, i dont have issues loading or patching. i just get random ping spikes that last been 3 seconds to 20 seconds that occur and rasndom intervals... 

i didnt have this issue when i lived alone  and 

like if i ping 192.168.1.1 i somtimes get crazy high ping and sometimes complete timeouts and somtimes 1-2 ms

all the ports have been forwarded through norton.. but i can control the router

replies.body: Hmmmm some of that description makes me wonder if the main problem you're running into is packet loss. Basically, packet loss is when parts of your connection get damaged or lost before it's able to reach our servers. Let's test for that really quickly by running a quick trace route using something like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) to our NA server 192.64.170.1. Paste what it gives you here and I can go over it with you!

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=8h3fZsJy,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-08-01T04:06:42.658+0000)
>
> Hmmmm some of that description makes me wonder if the main problem you're running into is packet loss. Basically, packet loss is when parts of your connection get damaged or lost before it's able to reach our servers. Let's test for that really quickly by running a quick trace route using something like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) to our NA server 192.64.170.1. Paste what it gives you here and I can go over it with you!

lol I'll run it... and post the data ... but i already KNOW i have packet loss

and this data wont be the normal data anyways... im at my grandpas house not my own so i am using a different router (although i did bring my desktop as we will be staying there for at least a week while we have people re-do our floors)

either way my dad set up both routers. and he "claims" his routers reads as "no packets lost" but my computer says otherwise when pining the router

Yeeeaaa those no responses are pretty troubling. Since you're aware of packet loss already, you may want to first try reaching out to your ISP to see if there are any issues with the nodes they're sending your connection through. Sometimes these issues happen due to one specific node being damaged, and they might be able to help out somehow.

If you'd like, go ahead and reach out to our tech team in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) too. They might be able to look over those network logs you have to see if they can adjust anything on your end to help.
